alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:13AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... North Fork Peachtree Creek at Briarwood Rd Atlanta affecting DeKalb County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...North Fork Peachtree Creek at Briarwood Rd Atlanta. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the banks upstream and downstream of the gage on Briarwood Road. Flooding of low lying portions of the Peachtree Creek Greenway occurs, particularly areas of the Greenway near Corporate Boulevard. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:01 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:01 AM EST Tuesday was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 11/30/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EST.
